FuncDef: The display ospf routing command displays the OSPF routing table. The display ospf routing command displays the OSPF routing table.
CLIs: display ospf [ <process-id> ] routing [ <ip-address> [ <mask> | <mask-length> ] ] [ [ interface { <interface-name> | <interfaceType> <interfaceNum> } ] [ nexthop <nexthop-ip-address> ] ] [ age { min-value <min-age-value> | max-value <max-age-value> } ]

ParaDef.Info:
OSPF process ID.
The value ranges from 1 to 4294967295.

Indicates destination IP addresses.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies a subnet mask.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the length of the prefix.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 32.

Specifies the type or the number of an interface.
-

Specifies an interface name.
The value is a character string.

Specifies the next-hop address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Displays information based on the age time.
-

Displays information about OSPF routes with the age value greater than or equal to the min-age-value value.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 4294967295.

Displays information only about LSAs with the age value less than or equal to the max-age-value value.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 4294967295.
